review.review_title: Great from inception, better every update
review.review_text: If you regularly use transit in one of the cities it covers, download this app to massively improve your quality of life. ... Now for TL;DR: Every schedule, route, and stop for every King County Metro or Sound Transit vehicle in my pocket. Realtime info on how off-schedule those vehicles are, based on radioed odometer data. All of the above integrated seamlessly with a handy map of the service area. Regular updates, mostly for the hard, thankless task of fixing bugs. It doesn't get better than this, folks.

review.star_rating: Rated 5 star_ratings out of five star_ratings
review.review_text: I love the app since I take the bus to work. But this last update has caused a problem with my list of star_ratingred stops. The screen only shows the top edge of each line, so I can't read the stop name. I have to click on each and see the actual times in order to see the stop name. Update: sent you a screenshot Update: Developer responded, and the next time they updated the app, my problem was also fixed. I really love this!

review.star_rating: Rated 3 star_ratings out of five star_ratings
review.review_text: I've used the iOS version on my iPod for years, and it has been vital for me. Not having access without wi-fi, I can't speak to how accurate arrivals have been, but it was useful for telling me when to leave the house and how to plan my trips. Today I finally got a smartphone and I am really confused by how different the Android version is. The apple version has tabs listing recent and bookmarked stops. The latter has been ESSENTIAL for being able to look at connecting buses when I have a route with transfers. But this version only gives me a map. I have to search for the next stop every time, and if I'm still far away, or don't remember the exact street... what a hassle. Not to mention that I can't easily switch between two stops (because sometimes I have a choice about which bus to take depending on which will arrive sooner between stops that are only a block apart.) And I notice that the view for the stops have a star_rating I can add at the top, so there SEEMS to still be favourites, but how can I view them? I really need those tabs back and then I can put the star_ratings back on this review.

review.review_title: The only way I catch my buses now!
review.review_text: Overall, this is a great app. My curry recently did trait service cuts, and the buses are now often running late or at different times, and this app is great for figuring out where the hell my bus is! The only reason I didn't give 5 star_ratings is because there's some functionality I miss from the iOS version -- particularly, seeing the times a given route will be at other stops without having to look for those stops and make a guess

review.review_text: Feels like this app just is getting older and older. Hardly can trust it to be accurate during peak hours anymore.

review.star_rating: Rated 1 star_ratings out of five star_ratings
review.review_text: Edit: actual practicality of this app is minimal, due to latency between gps fetching and actual bus time arrivals. Even when buses are late (or on time) bus drivers often compensate to reach the destination at the prescribed time. Thus it would be no different if not more safe with the actual timetable of the route than this app (that is, if you try and get to a bus stop even almost exactly on time, you will miss many a bus!)

review.star_rating: Rated 3 star_ratings out of five star_ratings
review.review_text: I went downtown via the 41. After I got downtown, did some shopping, I wanted to head home. The bus schedule was supposed to be set for holidays, but it wasn't. OBA was giving me a workweek schedule when the system was operating on a Sunday schedule. Not cool.

review.star_rating: Rated 2 star_ratings out of five star_ratings
review.review_text: Gave it a shot, but its departure times were straight up wrong. Watched a bus go by that it said wasn't due for 15 minutes; another bus that was supposed to be there came 10 minutes later. Compared it against the published times (it just uses scheduled times, not actual times) and saw it had the wrong info. Pretty basic fail.

review.star_rating: Rated 3 star_ratings out of five star_ratings
review.review_text: I waited for the bus this morning for an hour, no bus came when it said there was one. They need to post when a holiday schedule is in affect.

review.star_rating: Rated 2 star_ratings out of five star_ratings
review.review_text: How about updating the times to actually reflect holiday schedules? You know, so people don't end up at a bus stop thinking the bus will be there in 10 minutes but won't actually be there for an hour..

review.star_rating: Rated 4 star_ratings out of five star_ratings
review.review_text: Gotta say, this is a great app. I actually find myself using this more than the official Marta app. I can only think of two things that would make it just about perfect, & one thing that would be nice. 1: Have the time color meanings in the app itself, at the bottom or maybe via a quick view button/switch so as not too leave the schedule you're viewing. 2: Have a satellite view option on the map. Lastly something I know you might not be able to do is have a bus icon on the map that moves in real-time. That plus the satellite view would be really cool.

review.star_rating: Rated 5 star_ratings out of five star_ratings

review.star_rating: Rated 3 star_ratings out of five star_ratings
review.review_text: This app is only half as good as the same app on iPhone. Moving from iPhone to Android, I was delighted to see OBA was on Android. The thing I loved about the app was if I know a bus time 2 hours from now, I could look at the table information and get the bus number (the actual bus, not the route number) and if it changes to another route after it is finished with the run it is currently on. The android app does not do this. For me, it's important information. Please put it in!!

review.review_text: I wrote a review a while back in September that I accidentally deleted when I went to update it today (January). This app, while useful, still has the very annoying feature that it often crashes my phone when I click the back button on the 'list of coming buses' page for a given bus stop. It restar_ratingts the entire phone, so there is no opportunity to submit a bug report. None of the app updates have fixed this issue, at least not permanently. While the crashes are ultimately just an inconvenience, if Google ever implements decent real-time bus tracking in Google Maps for Seattle, I don't think I would keep using this app.

review.star_rating: Rated 2 star_ratings out of five star_ratings
review.review_title: Okay app most the time but be careful on holidays
review.review_text: Been using this app for a couple weeks now and it usually works well for the buses I ride (245, 255, 545). But had a bad experience on Thanksgiving Day where it showed the standard weekday schedule, not the Sunday schedule which it was on because of the holiday. Even if this was just a one-off oversight, it significantly reduced my confidence in the app and from now on I'll double check the King County Metro timetables before heading out the door. The only other small complaint is the map automatically centers to your current location. This makes sense the first time you go to map view, but if you've panned and zoomed the map to another area to check out its stops, when you return to the map, it should be where you left it. Since it auto-centers, it makes it really frustrating to research stops/routes that you may not be near at that moment. To end on a positive note, I do like the ability to add shortcuts to my star_ratingred bus stops/routes to my home screen.

review.review_text: This app is a huge help for checking out bus status, routes, and such. My only complaint is how little info is stored locally: if you aren't able to get a signal, it becomes almost completely useless because you can't view routes, stops, or even the timetables. If this contained all the info on routes and stops with it, or allowed you to download the timetables for specific busses and stops, it would be a perfect reference guide. As it is, it's very good if you have a data plan and/or constant wifi access.

May 1st at Pike & 6th in have the departure time at 6:42pm. Then at 6:35pm it changed to 6:47pm. Then changed at 6:40pm to 6:57pm (the scheduled departure). The 14 is not alone. There are MANY other routes that you are not accurate with. As more routes get GPS, I hope you accuracy gets better.

review.star_rating: Rated 3 star_ratings out of five star_ratings
review.review_text: The user interface could use some work. I just want to see a list of the stops I normally use when star_ratingt the app. Instead, it always star_ratingts by showing a map and I have to hit menu, and then My Stops to get to the list of my stops. Sometimes it shows departure times that don't actually exist. This morning it showed MT-346 at Aurora Village at 9:00. The 346 bus came a couple minutes after 9:00, but they pulled over into the parking lane and shut off the engine, so I checked the schedule on the Metro website. The next bus was not scheduled until 9:17. It must be showing what time the bus gets there, regardless of when the next departure time is. What good is that? I only care about when the bus is going to leave. I guess it's not really designed to work if you're catching a bus at a transit center where the bus might be there, but the driver might stop to take their break or something.

review.star_rating: Rated 3 star_ratings out of five star_ratings
review.review_text: In general, I think this is a useful app, and I use it all the time. It's quite accurate most of the time, but occasionally buses never show up or the schedule is way off, which is likely not a problem with the app, but from the data feed they receive. My biggest complaint with the app is that it splits many routes into sections, so it only displays part of the route. This is even the case when the route number doesn't change. When it displays the route, it shows it come to end at some point, when in reality it continues. The app knows this information, because under 'Show route information' it will show the route broken up into sections, but you can't display it that way, and you have to dig around to even find that much. The iPhone version has a way to display the other section, but you have to scroll to the bottom of the list of stops. Not at all obvious. The interface is very confusing. It's much better on the iPhone. I find myself constantly clicking around trying to figure out how to get the information I'm looking for. The iPhone version is much more intuitive. A complete UI overhaul is needed, but the core functionality is good.
